ovdesc.p: This table is used to setup generic settings for clearings used in payments hub as per Clearing,Currency and MessagePaymentType combination.

desc.p: Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY table
Specifies the name of the clearing in the payments hub.
The value links to the field ‘ClearingID’ in PPT.CLEARING table
Denotes the currency of the clearing account number.
Mandatory field. 3 alphanumeric characters. Value links to field 'CurrencyCode' in PPT.CLEARING table.
Holds a unique code which is used to identify the nature of clearing payment.
The value links to field 'ClearingNatureCode' PPT.CLEARINGNATURECODE
Indicates the direction of the message with respect to the payments hub.
Refers to type of payment message.
Value in this field links to field 'MessagePaymentType' PPT.MSGPAYMENTTYPE.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Holds 3 character company code of clearing account number.
Defaulted to the value filled in field, 'CompanyCode'.
Holds (Nostro) account of the clearing in the clearing currency.
Must be a valid account number in ACCOUNT table.
Holds 3 character currency code of clearing account number.
Defaulted to the value filled in the field, 'ClearingCurrency'.
Holds suspense account in the clearing currency to be used in case of a file-based clearing.
Holds Suspense account number in the clearing Currency to be used in case of a file-based clearing.
Holds suspense account currency in the clearing Currency to be used in case of a file-based clearing.
Defaulted to the value filled in the field, 'ClearingCurrency'.
Indicates whether the settlement transaction for the total amount of the clearing direct debit file must be created during de-bulking of individual transactions.
Bank in UK - BACS clearing – Direct Debit: The Settlement Booking indicator will be set to "N"

"Y" indicates the total amount of the clearing file is pre settled and the settlement transaction must be created at the time of de bulking .This will result in creation of addition transaction in addition to the sum
of individual payments during de bulking.

"N" indicates the clearing file total amount is not pre-settled or it is pre-settled and the bank prefers to create the settlement transaction for the successful payments at a pre-specified time later.
Defaulted to the value filled in the field, 'ClearingCurrency'.
Indicates whether manual verification is required before proceeding with processing the payment through the clearing.
Example: For The bank in UK - BACS clearing – Direct Debit: The manual verification indicator will be set to "Y".
Indicates the number of days to be added(plus) or subtracted(minus) to the processing date to arrive at the value date of the settlement and the individual transactions.
This date is applicable only if the processing date is present in the file.

Example: In certain cases clearing takes a day or two to settle the payment before it can be available to the beneficiary. This holds true for OUR correspondents which are operating in another time zone and can process out payments next day only (JPY).
Indicates whether a payment has to be sent to a wait queue for possible
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Indicates the user that created or modified the entry.
The value is not editable by the user.
Indicates the system date and time when the entry was created or modified.
It need to be displayed as DD MMM YYYY HH:MM:SS.sss.
The value is not editable by the user.
Indicates the name of the user who approved the entry.
The value is not editable by the user.
Indicates the system date and time when the entry was approved.
It need to be displayed as DD MMM YYYY HH:MM:SS.sss.
The value is not editable by the user.
It specifies if validations are required or not for that clearing.
It can take the values: Y or N.
If it is set to Y, the table PPT.ClearingValidations must be checked to retrieve the ValidationAPI.
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
